meanings.definition: The quality or state of being lame or disabled in the feet or legs.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's lameness made it difficult for him to run and play.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the lameness in the horse's leg and recommended rest.
meanings.sent3: The lameness of the old car's engine was evident as it sputtered and coughed.
meanings.sent4: The lameness of the argument was exposed when the flaws in the logic became clear.
meanings.sent5: The lameness of the dancer's footwork stood out during the performance.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being weak or inadequate.
meanings.sent1: The lameness of the bridge's structure was a cause for concern among engineers.
meanings.sent2: The lameness of the excuse was evident when the truth came to light.
meanings.sent3: The lameness of the umbrella's handle made it difficult to hold during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The lameness of the plan became apparent when it failed to address key issues.
meanings.sent5: The lameness of the battery's power was noticeable as the device quickly died.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unconvincing or unsatisfactory.
meanings.sent1: The lameness of the salesman's pitch failed to persuade the customer.
meanings.sent2: The lameness of the excuse left her teacher unconvinced.
meanings.sent3: The lameness of the joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The lameness of the plot twist left viewers disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The lameness of the product's quality was evident in its poor performance.
